marketNews.title: RAPBN 2026: Economy Targeted to Grow +5.4% via 8 Priority Programs
marketNews.content:
President Prabowo Subianto provided a state speech regarding the targets and programs for 2026, coinciding with the release of the 2026 State Budget Draft Financial Notes [see table above]. There are 8 government priority programs in 2026, namely: 1) food security; 2) energy security; 3) Free Nutritious Meals (MBG); 4) education; 5) health; 6) village, cooperative, and MSME development; 7) defense; and 8) acceleration of investment and global trade. Here are some of our important notes:
1. Food Security - The budget for this program increased by +32.6% YoY to IDR 164.6 trillion (vs. 2025 APBN: +8.8% YoY). Some uses of this budget include food distribution and reserves (IDR 29.9 trillion), production (IDR 114.1 trillion), and consumption (IDR 6.4 trillion).
2. Education and MBG - The education budget is set at IDR 757.8 trillion (+4.8% YoY), which is stated to be the highest in Indonesian history. This budget includes the budget for the MBG program amounting to IDR 335 trillion (vs. 2025 APBN: IDR 171 trillion), in line with the proposal from the National Nutrition Agency. The MBG program in 2026 is targeted to reach 82.9 million beneficiaries, up from the current level of around 20 million recipients.
3. Energy Security - The energy security budget is set at IDR 402.4 trillion, which will be allocated for energy subsidies, tax incentives, new and renewable energy (EBT) development, and village electricity supply. President Prabowo also reiterated his hope that 100% of electricity generation will come from EBT within the next 10 years, earlier than the global target of 2060.
4. Village, Cooperative, and MSME Development - The total budget reaches IDR 181.8 trillion, where the Merah Putih Village Cooperative (Kopdes) program will receive IDR 83 trillion support from the state budget to be channeled through Himbara (State-Owned Banks).
5. More Centralized State Expenditures - Out of the total state expenditure budget of IDR 3,787 trillion (+7.3% YoY), central government expenditures will increase by +17.8% YoY while the budget transfer to regions will decrease by -24.8% YoY.
6. 3 Million Houses Program - Around 770,000 housing units will be supported by the state budget with a total budget of IDR 57.7 trillion, mainly through the Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (FLPP).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Overall, the priority programs mentioned are in line with developments reported since the new government took office, so there are no surprises. Regarding the budget posture itself, we assess the target for a tax revenue increase of +13% YoY in 2026 to be challenging. We also assess the announcement of the budget for Kopdes Merah Putih amounting to IDR 83 trillion slightly provides certainty for SOE bank stocks. For comparison, with a loan ceiling of up to 3 billion per cooperative, the number of Kopdes reaching ~80,000 would require total funding up to IDR 240 trillion.

marketNews.title: Constitutional Court Rejects Material Test on PPN Increase in HPP Law
marketNews.content: The Constitutional Court on Thursday (14/8) rejected the request for a material test against Law No. 7/2021 concerning the harmonization of tax regulations. One of the lawsuits filed with the Constitutional Court was that the regulation did not provide a guarantee of legal certainty and a decent standard of living due to difficulties in fulfilling basic necessities. The Constitutional Court assessed that the range of VAT imposition rates of around 5-15% in the regulation is a flexible fiscal policy, allowing the government to adjust the rate based on national economic conditions and state fiscal needs while still considering the socio-economic conditions of the community. Furthermore, the Constitutional Court explained that the determination of the VAT rate within this range can only be determined by the government after being submitted to the DPR for discussion and agreement in the preparation of the State Budget Draft, thus still fulfilling the principle of 'no taxation without representation.'

marketNews.title: US Statistics Bureau Notes Producer Price Index Inflation in July Reached 0.9% MoM
marketNews.content: The US statistics bureau noted that producer price index inflation in the US reached 0.9% MoM in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 0% MoM), exceeding the consensus expectation of 0.2% MoM and marking the highest increase since June 2022.

marketNews.title: China's Retail Sales Growth Slows in July, Unemployment Rises
marketNews.content: China's statistics bureau noted that retail sales in China grew by +3.7% YoY in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: +4.8% YoY), lower than the consensus expectation of +4.6% YoY and marking the weakest growth since December 2024. This result put China's retail sales for 7M25 at +4.8% YoY. In other economic data, China's statistics bureau noted that China's unemployment rate in July 2025 rose to 5.2% (vs. June 2025: 5%), exceeding the consensus expectation of 5.1% and marking the highest figure since March 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTRO and RAJA Acquire 2 Hafar Group Companies
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea through its subsidiary, PT Petrosea Engineering Procurement Construction, and Rukun Raharja (RAJA) announced the acquisition of PT Hafar Daya Konstruksi and PT Hafar Daya Samudera. The total transaction value reached IDR 784 billion, with PT Petrosea Engineering Procurement Construction acquiring 51% of the shares in both companies for a total value of approximately IDR 400 billion, while the remaining 49% was acquired by RAJA for IDR 384 billion. PT Hafar Daya Konstruksi is engaged in the engineering, procurement, construction, and installation (EPCI) sector, while PT Hafar Daya Samudera is engaged in the marine transportation services business. PTRO explained that this acquisition is aimed at diversification into the oil and gas sector, while RAJA stated that this transaction is aimed at midstream sector development.

tickerNews.title: Jahja Setiaatmadja, President Commissioner of BBCA, Sells 1 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: BBCA: The President Commissioner of Bank Central Asia, Jahja Setiaatmadja, sold 1 million BBCA shares at an average price of IDR 8,750 per share on August 12, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 8.8 billion and was intended for portfolio diversification. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of Jahja Setiaatmadja in BBCA remains unchanged at around 0.03%.

tickerNews.title: MDKA Cuts 2025 Copper Production Guidance, Maintains Gold Production Guidance
tickerNews.content: MDKA: Merdeka Copper Gold cut its copper production volume guidance for 2025 from the range of 11,000-13,000 tons to around 10,000-12,000 tons, while the gold production volume guidance was maintained in the range of 100,000-110,000 troy ounces.

tickerNews.title: MBMA Cuts Nickel Pig Iron Production Guidance for 2025
tickerNews.content: MBMA: Merdeka Battery Materials cut its nickel pig iron production volume guidance for 2025 from the range of 80,000-87,000 tons to around 70,000-80,000 tons, while the guidance for limonite and saprolite production volumes were maintained at ranges of 12.5-15 million wmt and 6-7 million wmt, respectively. Furthermore, MBMA decided to temporarily halt the production of high-grade nickel matte due to margin volatility and prioritize the production of nickel pig iron. High-grade nickel matte production will resume if conditions support profitable operations.

tickerNews.title: LINK Clarifies Knowledge of Controller's Potential Sale to Strategic Investors
tickerNews.content: LINK: Link Net in a clarification to the IDX stated that the company is aware of preliminary considerations by its controller to access potential strategic investors, but the company has not received further information from its controller regarding this matter or its developments. The clarification delivered by LINK emerged after DealStreetAsia reported that the Axiata group is entering the final stages of selling its majority stake in LINK with an estimated value exceeding US$1 billion. Several DealStreetAsia sources mentioned that Digital Synergy Solutions (WIFI) and I Squared Capital are the leading potential buyers. Besides these two companies, the Salim and Sinar Mas groups are also reportedly interested.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Announces Gas Supply Decline Impacting Customers in West Java and Parts of Sumatra
tickerNews.content: PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara announced that the company is currently experiencing a decline in gas delivery, which is impacting some customers in the West Java region and parts of Sumatra. This condition is caused by an unplanned shutdown of the existing gas supplier and several additional gas supplies that are still in the finalization process. PGAS explained that the company, along with all stakeholders, is taking accelerated steps to secure additional gas and LNG supply allocations and deliver them back to customers as quickly as possible.

tickerNews.title: MDIY Controller Transfers 35.14% Stake in Share Transfer Transaction Valued at IDR 11.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: MDIY: The controller of Daya Intiguna Yasa, Azara Alpina Sdn. Bhd., transferred 8.8 billion (35.14%) MDIY shares to several parties, including MDIH (Singapore) Pte. Ltd., Suncoast Financial Investments Ltd., and Tan Yu Yeh (the ultimate beneficial owner of the company), and others. The transfer price was IDR 1,300 per share, making the total transaction value reach IDR 11.5 trillion. After this transaction, the ownership of Azara Alpina Sdn. Bhd. in MDIY decreased from 85.71% to 50.57%, while public ownership increased from 10.24% to 16.81%.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Director Sells Shares Resulting in Ownership Decrease
tickerNews.content: AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional Director, David Alexander Gibbs, sold approximately 3.5 million AMMN shares at an average price of IDR 8,635 per share on August 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 30.5 billion. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of David Alexander Gibbs in AMMN decreased from 0.016% to 0.011%.

tickerNews.title: LPKR Records Marketing Sales of IDR 2.47 Trillion in 1H25
tickerNews.content: LPKR: Lippo Karawaci recorded marketing sales amounting to IDR 2.47 trillion during 1H25 (-21.3% YoY), equivalent to 40% of the 2025 target of IDR 6.25 trillion.

tickerNews.title: FUTR Controller Enters Term Sheet for Sale of 49.325% Stake
tickerNews.content: FUTR: Futura Energi Global announced that PT Aurora Dhana Nusantara has signed a term sheet for the planned acquisition of approximately 3.3 billion (49.325%) FUTR shares from the existing controller, PT Digital Futurama Global. The total transaction value and completion time have not yet been announced. The signing of the term sheet itself cannot yet be considered a transaction resulting in a change of control under POJK No. 9/2018 until the completion of the planned acquisition as stipulated in the conditional share purchase agreement.

tickerNews.title: Two Largest IMPC Shareholders Sell Shares in Mid-August Transactions
tickerNews.content: IMPC: Two of the largest shareholders in Impack Pratama Industri, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa and PT Tunggal Jaya Investama, respectively sold 600 million (1.11%) and 800 million (1.47%) IMPC shares at an average price of IDR 660 per share on August 13-14, 2025. The total transaction values reached IDR 396 billion and IDR 528 billion, respectively. After these transactions, the ownership of PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa in IMPC decreased from 45.84% to 44.73%, while the ownership of PT Tunggal Jaya Investama decreased from 44.09% to 42.62%.
